Package phonebookApp

Class PhoneBook

java.lang.Object
phonebookApp.PhoneBook
Direct Known Subclasses:
SavedPhoneBook
public class PhoneBook extends Object
A simple class to store a list of names and phone numbers.
Version:
2024-CI401-CW-PhoneBookApp
Author:
Roger

  • Field Details

    • phoneNumbers

      protected TreeMap<String,String> phoneNumbers
      a phone book object. We use a TreeMap to store numbers associated with names. TreeMap is an ordered map, so when we loop over the map, the entries are in alphabetical order.

    • view

      View view

  • Constructor Details

      public PhoneBook()
      constructor for objects of class PhoneBook

  • Method Details

    • clear

      public void clear()
      clears all the entries from the PhoneBook

    • addPhoneNumber

      public void addPhoneNumber(String name, String number)
      adds a name and phone number to the PhoneBook
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the person
      number - the phone number (as a String)

    • removePhoneNumber

      public void removePhoneNumber(String name, String number)
      deletes a name and phone number from the PhoneBook
      Parameters:
      name - - Who is the person?
      number - - The phone number of the person (as a String)
      remove - - Removes the key from the TreeMap

    • getPhoneNumber

      public String getPhoneNumber(String name)
      retrieves phone number from the PhoneBook
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the person
      Returns:
      the phone number (as a String) or null if the person is not in the phone book

    • listing

      public String listing()
      creates a String listing all the entries in the PhoneBook
      Returns:
      the listing, with each entry on a separate line

    • listingApp

      public String listingApp()

    • printListing

      public void printListing()
      prints a listing of the PhoneBook on the Console output
